Requirements: To be considered for admission in good standing, freshman applicants must have a high school diploma and meet ONE of the following: 3.0 GPA or higher; OR a minimum 22 ACT composite (1020 SAT) and a minimum 2.7 high school GPA. Beginning with the Fall 2021 semester, MTSU will be test-optional for admissions. Freshman applicants who do not meet the 3.0 GPA requirement for guaranteed admission may still be admitted. MTSU will calculate a holistic score based on a combination of your GPA and any ACT/SAT test scores you submit.

To be considered for admission, applicants must complete the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit official high school transcripts. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is not required for admission consideration. For assured admission, a first-time freshman needs a 3.0+ high school GPA. Admission by holistic review is for students with a 2.70-2.99 high school GPA; these students may be asked to submit a personal statement to be reviewed by the admissions committee.

Admission to the Art, B.F.A., Studio Art Concentration, requires formal application to the Department of Art and Design. This is a competitive entry program. Each spring semester, a faculty committee reviews portfolios of applicants currently enrolled in the Art B.A. or B.S. program (or transfer equivalent coursework) who have completed the Art and Design Core with a minimum 2.50 GPA and an overall GPA of 2.00.

Admission to the School of Music requires both admission to Middle Tennessee State University and a successful audition on a primary instrument or voice. Auditions occur throughout the year before a faculty panel for entrance the following fall semester. For general university admission, MTSU has a test-optional policy for most applicants. For assured admission, applicants must have a 3.0 high school GPA or higher, or a 2.70-2.99 GPA and a 19 ACT composite (990 SAT) score.
Students may select General Science as their major upon being admitted to MTSU.

Admission to the MTSU School of Nursing is competitive. Meeting minimum criteria for admission does not guarantee admission to the program. All applicants must meet the following minimum requirements to be considered for admission:
1. Be admitted to MTSU. See Undergraduate Admissions for University admission criteria.
2. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale.
3. Completion of 45 semester hours to include the following courses with a grade of C or better: ENGL 1010, ENGL 1020, MATH 1710, BIOL 2010/2011, BIOL 2020/2021, CHEM 1030/1031 (or higher level chemistry), and PSY 1410. Courses cannot be in progress at time of application.
4. A satisfactory score on a nursing admission test specified by the School of Nursing. HESI A2 is the current admission test. Information on the required sections of the test, how to register and test dates will be provided at information sessions and will be posted on the School of Nursing website. There must be a minimum of 6 months between testing dates if the student is repeating the admission test. Scores are good for one calendar year.
5. Submission of the School of Nursing application with all required documentation by the posted deadline.

Admission to the Social Work program is separate from admission to the university. Students must apply to the university as pre-social work majors and then apply to the Social Work program after completing 45 hours of coursework. Admission to the program is competitive. To apply, a student must have: completed a minimum of 45 semester hours of coursework; a minimum overall GPA of 2.25; completed SW 2110 with a grade of C or better; submitted the Social Work Program Application for Admission (including a personal essay); successfully completed an admission interview with Social Work faculty; and completed SOWK 2110, ENGL 1010, ENGL 1020, and COMM 2200.

First-time freshmen who meet the following criteria will be granted full admission to the University: Graduated from high school or successfully completed the GED, HiSet, or TASC, and Submitted a qualifying test score (22 ACT or 1100 SAT or a 3.0 High School GPA), and Completed the 16-course college preparatory curriculum.

An applicant for admission as a freshman must be a graduate of an accredited high school with a regular diploma and have a minimum high school GPA of 3.0. Applicants who do not meet the 3.0 GPA minimum may be admitted with a 2.7 GPA and an 18 ACT (960 SAT).
Admission to the Audio Production program is highly competitive and is based on a review of student academic records after the completion of a set of lower-division prerequisite courses at MTSU.

To be considered for admission, prospective freshmen must submit a completed application, a nonrefundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. For students who choose to submit test scores with their application, admission will be granted based on the following: Regular Admission: 22 ACT or 1100 SAT and 3.0 GPA. For students who choose to apply without test scores (Test-Optional), admission will be granted based on the following: Test-Optional Admission: 3.5 GPA.

Assured admission will be granted to students who meet one of the following criteria:
- 3.0 GPA or higher
- 2.7 GPA and an ACT composite score of 20 (or SAT of 1020) or higher
- ACT composite score of 22 (or SAT of 1100) or higher

Admission to the Mechatronics Engineering program requires a minimum ACT Mathematics subscore of 22 (or SAT equivalent) and a high school GPA of 3.0. Students not meeting this standard will be admitted to the Pre-Mechatronics Engineering program.

To be admitted to the university, prospective freshmen must meet one of the following criteria for assured admission: 3.0 GPA, or 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT of 1020), or 2.5 GPA and an ACT score of 22 (or SAT of 1100). After being admitted to MTSU, students seeking to major in Recording Industry must apply for candidacy in a specific concentration. For the Music Business concentration, a resume and a statement of goals are required. For the Commercial Songwriting concentration, a portfolio of two original songs (audio recording and lyric sheet) and a statement of goals are required.
Program name: Recording Industry, B.S. (Commercial Songwriting | Music Business)

Requirements: Admission to the Video and Film Production major is not competitive. Any student admitted to MTSU may declare a major in Video and Film Production. General university admission requirements for freshmen include one of the following paths: Earn a 3.0 high school GPA (test-optional), OR earn a 2.7 high school GPA AND an ACT score of 21 or an SAT score of 1060, OR meet GPA and test score combinations on a sliding scale.
Program name: Video & Film Production, B.S. (Live Production and Filmmaking concentrations)

Requirements:
Admission to the university is a separate procedure from admission to the Aerospace Department. For university admission, to be considered for guaranteed admission, applicants must have a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite score of 22 (or 1100 SAT total score) AND meet High School Core requirements. For regular admission, applicants must have a minimum ACT composite of 20 (or 1020 SAT total score) AND a minimum 2.7 high school GPA. MTSU is test-optional for students who have a 3.0 high school GPA.

Formal admission to the Aerospace Department is an additional process. All students enter the university as Pre-Aerospace majors and must meet specific requirements to be admitted into one of the six concentrations. Admission to an Aerospace concentration is limited to students who have completed at least 15 semester hours of college-level work, earned an overall minimum grade point average (GPA) of 2.50, and earned a grade of 'C' or better in AERO 1010 and AERO 1020.
Program name: Aerospace B.S. (Aviation Management, Flight Dispatch, Maintenance Management, Professional Pilot, Technology only)

Requirements:
The I/O Psychology major is an upper-division major. This means that students must be admitted to the major before they are able to enroll in our upper division major courses (PSY 3020, PSY 4260, PSY 4280, PSY 4290, PSY 4770, and PSY 4900). To be considered for admission to the I/O Psychology major, students must meet the following minimum requirements:
1. Completion of at least 30 credit hours.
2. An overall GPA of 3.0 or better.
3. Completion of PSY 1410 with a grade of B- or better.
4. Completion of PSY 2020 or an equivalent course with a grade of C or better.
5. An average GPA of 3.0 or better for all psychology (PSY) courses.

Admission to the Jones College of Business is required. For full admission to the Jones College of Business, students must have a 2.50 overall GPA and have completed certain lower-division business courses.

Admission to the Media Management, B.S. program is based on general undergraduate admission to Middle Tennessee State University. According to the MTSU Undergraduate Catalog, 'Any student may be a Media Management major.' General freshman admission requirements are based on high school GPA and/or ACT/SAT scores. For Fall 2024 and 2025 terms, MTSU is test-optional, allowing admission for students with a 3.0 high school GPA without a test score. For students who submit scores, guaranteed admission includes criteria such as a 3.5+ high school GPA, or a 3.0+ GPA combined with a minimum 22 ACT composite or 1100 SAT total score.

Admission to MTSU is required for this program. Once admitted, students can declare a major in Aerospace with a concentration in Flight Dispatch or Unmanned Aircraft Systems. General freshman admission to MTSU is test-optional and based on high school GPA.

Assured Admission criteria:
- 3.0 GPA or higher
- OR 2.99-2.5 GPA AND an ACT composite of 22 or higher (or SAT equivalent)
- OR 2.49 GPA or lower AND an ACT composite of 24 or higher (or SAT equivalent)

Applicants who do not meet the assured admission requirements will have their application reviewed holistically.
Program name: Aerospace B.S. (Flight Dispatch, Unmanned Aircraft Systems only)

Requirements: Admission to the Engineering Technology program requires that students meet the University's general admission requirements.

No special admission requirements for this program. Admission is based on general university admission standards. For freshmen, MTSU will guarantee admission to first-time freshmen who have a 3.0 GPA or higher OR an ACT composite of 22 (or 1100 SAT) or higher. Students who do not meet the guaranteed admission requirements will have their application reviewed holistically. Several factors are considered in the holistic review process, including but not limited to, high school GPA, ACT/SAT scores, dual enrollment coursework, the rigor of high school curriculum, and student involvement. High School Curriculum requirements: 14 units are required for regular admission including: 4 units of English; 3 units of Math (including Algebra I & II, Geometry); 3 units of science (including Biology I, Chemistry I or Physics); 1 unit of U.S. History; 1 unit of world history or world geography; 2 units of the same foreign language; and 1 unit of visual or performing arts.

To be admitted to the university, students must meet assured admission requirements. For students who do not meet assured admission, a holistic review of their application will be considered. Due to the ongoing impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic, MTSU will be test-optional for students applying for admission through fall 2025.

In addition to meeting the University's admission requirements, all students intending to major in music must audition for acceptance into the School of Music as a major. Auditions are held on several dates during the spring semester for students who intend to enter the University in the fall. An audition can be scheduled for students who cannot attend on one of the specified dates. For information concerning the audition, contact the director of the School of Music. Students who do not perform a successful audition may be admitted to the University as pre-music majors, but they may not take applied music courses for credit toward a degree or major in any ensemble until they have successfully passed an audition.

Guaranteed admission will be granted to students with a 3.0 high school GPA or greater. Guaranteed admission will also be granted to students with an ACT composite score of 22 or an SAT score of 1100 (ERW+M) and a 2.7 high school GPA. First-time freshmen who are U.S. citizens or eligible non-citizens graduating from a U.S. high school with at least a 3.0 high school GPA may apply for test-optional admission.
Program name: Textiles Merchandising and Design (Fashion Merchandising and Apparel Design)

Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following: Regular admission: 3.0 GPA or higher. Conditional admission: minimum 2.7 GPA and completion of the core high school courses. If you do not meet regular or conditional admission requirements, you may be eligible for admission through a holistic review. MTSU is a test-optional university. Applicants may submit ACT/SAT test scores, but they are not required for admission consideration.

To be admitted to the Jones College of Business, students must
1. Have a minimum of 30 semester hours earned.
2. Have a minimum 2.25 overall GPA.
3. Complete the following courses with a grade of C or better: ENGL 1010, ENGL 1020; MATH 1630, MATH 1810 or MATH 1910; COMM 2200.
4. Complete the following courses with an average GPA of 2.25 or higher and a grade of C or better: ACCT 2110, ACCT 2120; ECON 2410, ECON 2420; INFS 2400 (or QM 2610).

To be considered for admission, you must submit the following: An application for admission, a $25 nonrefundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Regular admission is granted to students who have a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite of 22 or higher OR an SAT total of 1100 or higher. Middle Tennessee State University is a test-optional institution. You can choose whether to have your ACT or SAT scores included in your admissions review.

For assured admission, freshmen must meet one of the following criteria: Option 1: 3.0 GPA, Option 2: 2.7 GPA and 21 ACT / 1060 SAT, Option 3: Less than 2.7 GPA and 22 ACT / 1100 SAT. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements may be reviewed for holistic admission. All students seeking admission must have completed the required high school units: 4 English; 3 Math (including Algebra I, II, Geometry); 3 Natural/Physical Science (including 1 Biology and 1 Chemistry); 1 Social Science/History; 1 U.S. History; and 2 in the same Foreign Language or Fine Art.

To be considered for admission, first-time freshmen must have a minimum high school GPA of 2.7. Meeting this minimum requirement does not guarantee admission. Assured Admission is granted to students with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher, or a high school GPA of 2.7 with an ACT score of 22 or higher (or SAT equivalent). Applicants who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission through a holistic review.

To be considered for admission as a first-time freshman, a student must present a transcript of credits from an accredited high school showing graduation and the date of graduation. Assured admission is granted to students with a 3.0 GPA or higher, or a 2.7 GPA or higher combined with an ACT composite of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent of 1020). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be considered for admission based on a holistic review.

To declare a major in the Department of Aerospace, students must meet the Guaranteed Admission Standards for the University. For regular admission for students graduating high school in Spring 2021 and after, the requirements are: Completion of the secondary school Core unit requirements AND a minimum 3.0 high school GPA OR a minimum 2.7 high school GPA AND a minimum 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite. MTSU is currently test-optional for students applying through Fall 2025; students who have a 3.0 GPA or higher are not required to submit a test score for an admission decision.

To be considered for admission, you will need: A completed undergraduate application for admission; Payment of the non-refundable application fee; An official high school transcript; Official ACT and/or SAT scores (optional for most applicants). Assured Admission criteria are a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher OR a high school GPA of 2.7 and an ACT score of 22 or an SAT score of 1100. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a combination of high school GPA and test scores, plus other information you wish to provide such as a recommendation from a school counselor or an essay.

Admission to MTSU is based on a review of a student's academic achievements and potential for success. The university uses a 4.0 grading scale. In addition to the application for admission, students must submit a non-refundable application fee, official high school transcripts, and ACT or SAT scores. Some students may need to provide additional information.
Program name: Aerospace, Unmanned Aircraft Systems Operations Concentration, B.S.

Requirements:
Admission to MTSU is a separate procedure from admission to an academic program. After being admitted to the University, students desiring to major in Aerospace must meet the following requirements to be admitted to the program:

Minimum 2.50 cumulative GPA
Completion of MATH 1710 College Algebra (or higher)
Completion of ENGL 1010
Completion of AERO 1010
Minimum grade of "C" in all Aerospace courses
Program name: Aerospace, Unmanned Aircraft Systems Technology Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: To be considered for admission, you should complete the required 16 college preparatory courses in high school and have either: A 3.0 GPA or higher OR; A minimum 2.7 GPA and a 19 ACT (990 SAT) or higher OR; A minimum score of 21 ACT (1060 SAT) regardless of GPA. MTSU offers a Test Optional pathway for Fall 2024, Spring 2025, and Summer 2025: Applicants who do not meet the test score requirements for regular admission, can be considered test optional with a 3.0+ high school GPA.

To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following:

22 ACT composite (or 1100 SAT total) OR
3.0 GPA

Test scores are not required for admission. If you apply without test scores, you must have a 3.0 high school GPA for an admission decision. If you choose to submit scores, they must be sent directly from the testing agency.

Admission to the university is assured for applicants who meet one of the following:

Option 1: 3.0 GPA or higher

Option 2: 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent)

Option 3: 2.7 GPA, 19 ACT (or SAT equivalent), and a grade of C or better in all core classes

Option 4: The student’s GPA and test score combination are reviewed based on our Freshman Admission Standards table.

Prior to enrolling in any upper-division (3000-4000 level) courses, students must be fully admitted to the Teacher Education Program. Requirements for admission include at least a 2.75 overall GPA, successful completion of the Praxis Core Academic Skills Test for Educators (or equivalent ACT/SAT scores), and passing a formal interview.
Program name: Art Education, Art Education K-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to the Department of Art and Design requires the completion of the University’s general education requirements for admission. General freshman admission requirements include completing the undergraduate application, paying the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submitting an official high school transcript. Submission of official ACT or SAT scores is optional for students with a 3.0 GPA or higher.

Admission to the Graphic Design concentration is selective. Students enter the B.F.A. in Art as 'pre-Graphic Design' majors and apply for the B.F.A. in Graphic Design candidacy by submitting a portfolio for review during the semester they are taking ART 2320 Typographic Design II. Students who successfully pass the portfolio review will be granted access to upper-division Graphic Design coursework.

To apply to the B.F.A. in Studio Art, students must first be admitted to the University. Visit the Undergraduate Admissions Office website for University requirements. Admission to the Department of Art and Design for the B.F.A. in Art with a Studio Art Concentration is a separate process. Students apply directly to the Department of Art and Design after completing a specific sequence of foundation-level courses.

Departmental Admission: Upon successful completion of the Studio Art Foundations courses with an average of B (3.00) or better, students may apply to the B.F.A. program. Application must be made to the Department of Art and Design during the fourth week of the semester in which the candidate is completing the Foundations program. The candidate must present a portfolio of selected works from the Foundations courses to a faculty committee for review and possible acceptance into the B.F.A. degree program. The portfolio should represent the student's best works from ART 1610 - Drawing I, ART 1620 - 2-D Design, ART 1630 - Drawing II, and ART 1640 - 3-D Design. The student's overall GPA will also be considered.

Admission to the Art, Visual Arts Concentration, B.S./B.A. requires the following: Submission of a departmental application. Submission of a portfolio. Admission to the Department of Art and Design for the B.A. and B.S. is based on submission of a portfolio of 10-15 images of original artwork that represents the applicant's abilities. Portfolios are reviewed once each semester for admission the following semester. Fall Deadline: April 1; Spring Deadline: Nov. 1. Students are notified of their status by mail within a month of the deadline. Students not admitted may re-apply the following semester. A student transferring to MTSU who wishes to declare an Art major is expected to have a minimum 2.00 GPA.

MTSU uses a comprehensive review process for admission that includes both your high school GPA and your test scores (ACT or SAT). Assured Admission: High school GPA of 3.0 or higher AND ACT composite of 22 or higher (or SAT of 1100 or higher). Test Optional Admission (through Summer 2025): High School GPA of 3.5 or higher. Holistic Review: Applicants who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a holistic review of their academic and non-cognitive achievements.
Admission to MTSU is a separate process from applying to a major. Please visit the Undergraduate Admissions website for admission requirements.

Admission to the Teacher Education Program is a separate process from admission to the university. A student must meet the requirements for admission to the university and the requirements for admission to the Teacher Education Program. Please see an advisor for admission requirements for teacher education.

To be considered for admission, you must meet the following high school course requirements and one of the following: 3.0 GPA OR 22 ACT composite (1020 SAT). Required high school units: 4 English; 3 Math (Algebra I & II, Geometry); 2 Natural/Physical Science; 1 Social Studies; 1 U.S. History; 2 Foreign Language; 1 Visual or Performing Arts. All students must submit an application for admission, a non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is not required for applicants with a 3.0 high school GPA or greater.

Guaranteed freshman admission is offered to applicants who meet one of the following: 3.0 cumulative high school GPA (test score not required) or 2.7 cumulative high school GPA and a 22 ACT (1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements may be reviewed for admission on an individual basis.
Meet ONE of the following: A 3.0 GPA with no minimum test score; A 2.7 GPA and a minimum 19 ACT or 990 SAT; A 2.5 GPA and a minimum 21 ACT or 1060 SAT.
Program name: Communication, Culture and Social Influence Concentration, B.S./B.A.

Requirements: Application requirements are for general university admission. To be considered for admission to the university, applicants must submit an application, a $25 non-refundable application fee, and an official high school transcript. Middle Tennessee State University provides a test-optional path for undergraduate admission, meaning ACT/SAT scores are not required for students with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. Assured university admission can be met by one of the following: 3.0 GPA or higher; 2.99-2.70 GPA and at least an 18 ACT or 940 SAT; 2.69-2.50 GPA and at least a 19 ACT or 980 SAT; 2.49 or lower GPA and at least a 21 ACT or 1060 SAT. According to the university catalog, admission to the University does not guarantee admission to the Communication major. To be admitted to the major, students must have a 2.50 overall GPA.

To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following: a 3.0 GPA; a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT equivalent); or a GPA below 2.7 with an ACT score of 22 (or SAT equivalent). Test score submission is optional for students with a 3.0 GPA or higher. Submission is encouraged for all students for scholarship consideration and course placement. MTSU does not require the writing component of the ACT or SAT.
Program name: Computer Science, Artificial Intelligence Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Regular admission is granted to students who have a 3.0 GPA or an ACT composite of 22 (or SAT total of 1100) and have completed the required high school curriculum. Note: MTSU will not require an ACT or SAT score for admissions consideration for students applying for the Fall 2021 through Spring 2025 terms. Admission to the Computer Science program also requires a separate application process to the upper division after admission to the University.
Program name: Computer Science, Business Applications Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to the Computer Science major requires an overall GPA of 2.00. First-time freshmen may be admitted directly to the major. Others may be admitted as pre-majors until they have a declared major GPA of 2.00 or better in at least 12 hours of CSCI courses taken at MTSU.
Program name: Computer Science, Cybersecurity Systems Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: MTSU will continue its test-optional admission policy for students applying. Students who do not submit ACT/SAT scores will be reviewed for admission based on their high school grade point average (GPA). Meet one of the following criteria: 22 ACT composite (or 1100 SAT equivalent) OR 3.0 high school GPA.
Program name: Computer Science, Professional Computer Science Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Regular admission is granted to students with a 3.0 GPA, regardless of test score (test optional), OR a 2.7 GPA with a 20 ACT/1020 SAT. Students with a 2.7 GPA and no test score will have a comprehensive review of their high school record. Applicants with a GPA below 2.7 will be holistically reviewed based on a combination of test scores, high school grades, and other information provided with the application.
Program name: Concrete Industry Management, Concrete Contracting Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: MTSU is a test-optional university. ACT/SAT scores are not required for admission but are used for scholarship and course placement consideration. ASSURED ADMISSION: 3.0 GPA OR; 2.7 GPA and 22 ACT (1100 SAT) OR; GPA below 2.7 and 24 ACT (1160 SAT). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be considered for admission under a holistic review. The holistic review will consider GPA, test scores (if submitted), and high school academic coursework.
Program name: Concrete Industry Management, Production, Sales and Service Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: To be considered for admission, you must submit an application and an official high school transcript. Assured Admission requires one of the following: 3.0 GPA OR 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT of 1020). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements or choose not to submit test scores can be reviewed for admission on an individual basis.
Program name: Construction Management, Commercial Construction Management Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to MTSU does not guarantee admission to the Concrete Industry Management or Construction Management program. All students enter the program under a pre-major status. To be admitted to the major, students must have completed a minimum of 30 semester hours with a cumulative GPA of at least 2.25, passed MATH 1710 (or higher), and passed CIM 1010 or ET 1110 with a C or better.
Program name: Construction Management, Land Development/Residential Building Construction Management Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: MTSU has adopted a test-optional admission policy. This means if you have a 3.0 GPA or higher, you do not have to submit ACT/SAT scores for an admission decision. Assured admission will be granted to students with a: 3.0 GPA or higher; OR 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 19 or higher (or SAT of 990); OR A GPA between 2.7 - 2.99 and completion of the 16 college prep courses.

For unconditional admission, you must have a 3.0 GPA OR a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 22 or higher (or SAT equivalent). We do holistic reviews on all applicants to ensure we are looking at the whole person. We encourage you to send any additional information you would like us to consider. A personal statement (optional), letters of recommendation, and an official seven-semester transcript may be requested. Test scores are now optional for admission but will be required for scholarship consideration and course placement in math and English.
To be considered for guaranteed freshman admission, you must meet ONE of the following: 2.7 or higher cumulative high school GPA; Redesigned SAT score of 1020 or higher; ACT score of 20 or higher.

MTSU practices assured admission for first-time freshmen. This means students who meet the following criteria will be admitted to the university.

Requirements:
Complete the college preparatory curriculum AND meet ONE of the following: 3.0 GPA OR ACT composite of 22 or higher OR SAT of 1100 or higher.

College Preparatory Course Requirements: 4 English; 3 Math (Algebra I, II, Geometry or equivalent); 3 Natural/Physical Science; 1 Social Studies/Science; 1 U.S. History; 2 Foreign Language; 1 Fine Arts.
Program name: Emergency Management and Homeland Security, B.S.

Requirements: MTSU practices holistic review for undergraduate admission, meaning we look for students who have a high probability of success and who will persist to graduation. To determine this, we will review your high school academic performance and your ACT/SAT scores (if you choose to submit them). You must submit a final high school transcript upon graduation. High school graduates with a 3.0 GPA or higher are assured admission. OR High school graduates with a minimum 2.7 GPA and a 20 ACT (1020 SAT) are assured admission. Applicants who do not meet the assured admission requirements will be reviewed holistically.
Program name: Engineering Technology, Computer Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.

Requirements:
MTSU offers guaranteed admission to students who meet the following academic criteria:
- Complete the recommended high school curriculum
- Meet ONE of the following:
    - 3.0 GPA
    - 2.7 GPA AND 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite

Students who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a holistic review of their academic profile.
Program name: Engineering Technology, Electromechanical Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: For information regarding admission to the university, please visit the undergraduate admissions website at www.mtsu.edu/apply. In addition to university admission requirements, students should complete a geometry course and two years of algebra with a grade of C or better.
Program name: Engineering Technology, Mechanical Engineering Technology Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: To be considered for guaranteed admission, you must meet one of the following criteria: 3.0 GPA or 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT). Students who don't meet guaranteed admission requirements can be reviewed for holistic admission by submitting: An official high school transcript, An official ACT or SAT score, The personal statement portion of the application.

First-time freshmen who meet one of the following criteria are guaranteed admission to MTSU: 3.0 GPA OR 2.7 GPA and 20 ACT (1020 SAT) OR 2.5 GPA and 22 ACT (1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet the guaranteed admission requirements may be considered for admission on a holistic basis. Required documents include an application for admission, a $25 application fee, official high school transcript(s), and official ACT and/or SAT scores (optional for most students).
To be fully admitted to the English B.A. program, students must have a 2.0 GPA.
Program name: English, English Language Linguistics Concentration, B.S./B.A.

Requirements:
MTSU offers assured admission to students who meet the following academic criteria:
- High school GPA of 3.0 or higher
- OR ACT composite score of 22 or higher
- OR SAT composite score of 1100 or higher

If you do not meet the assured admission criteria, your application will be reviewed to determine your probability of success.

MTSU offers test-optional admission to students with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher.

If you have a GPA below 3.0, you will need to submit ACT/SAT scores to be considered for admission:
- High school GPA of 2.7 or higher AND ACT composite score of 20 or higher OR SAT composite score of 1020 or higher

Admission to MTSU is a separate process from admission to the English major. All English majors must meet the admission requirements of the University. To be considered for admission, prospective freshmen must meet one of the following criteria: 3.0 GPA; 2.7 GPA and 21 ACT / 1060 SAT; 2.5 GPA and 23 ACT / 1130 SAT. MTSU is test-optional for admission. Freshman applicants with a 3.0 GPA may be admitted without a test score. Applicants with a 2.99 GPA or below should submit a test score for admission consideration.
Program name: English, Literature and Culture Concentration, B.A.

Requirements: Students must be formally admitted to the Teacher Education Program through the College of Education. Candidates must meet the following requirements to be considered for formal admission to the Teacher Education Program: Minimum overall GPA of 2.8. Passing scores on the Praxis CORE tests (Reading, Writing, and Mathematics) or a minimum ACT composite score of 21 or SAT composite score of 1020 (prior to 2016) or 1080 (2016 and after). Completion of ENGL 1010, 1020, and SPCH 1010/COMM 2200 with a grade of C or better. Successful completion of an interview. Completion of a minimum of 45 semester hours. Recommendation from academic advisor. Signed disposition form. Grade of C or better in all major required courses, if applicable. A clear background check.
Program name: English, Secondary English Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A.

Requirements: MTSU practices rolling admission and will notify you of your admission decision after we receive all of your required documents. To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following criteria: Assured Admission - 3.0 GPA; OR Holistic Review - 2.7 GPA OR 22 ACT/1100 SAT. A final high school transcript will be required to confirm graduation and final GPA. Required Application Documents: Completed online application for admission; Nonrefundable $25 application fee; Official high school transcript.

To be admitted to the Jones College of Business, a student must meet the following requirements: 1. Admission to MTSU. 2. An overall GPA of 2.25. 3. Completion of all lower-division business courses (ACTG 2110, BLAW 3400, ECON 2410, ECON 2420, INFS 3100, MATH 1630, and QM 2610) with a grade of C- or better.

General university admission requirements for freshmen include a 3.0 GPA, OR a 2.5 GPA and an ACT score of 22 (or SAT of 1100). Test scores (ACT/SAT) are not required for admission for first-time freshmen for Fall 2024. In addition to general university admission requirements, students seeking a B.B.A. degree from the Jones College of Business must meet the following requirements before taking upper-division business courses: completion of 60 semester hours; a minimum 2.25 cumulative GPA; and completion of all lower-division business courses with a C or better.

Meet one of the following criteria: 2.7 GPA or 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT). Required High School Coursework: 4 units of English / 3 units of math (Algebra I, II, Geometry or equivalent) / 3 units of lab science / 1 unit of U.S. history / 1 unit of world history or geography / 2 units of the same foreign language / 1 unit of fine arts.

To be admitted to MTSU, you should have either: A cumulative high school GPA of 3.0 or higher; OR An ACT composite of 22 or an SAT total of 1100 or higher; OR A cumulative high school GPA of 2.7 or higher AND an ACT composite of 19 or an SAT total of 990 or higher. MTSU will not require an ACT or SAT score for admission for most students. Applicants who do not submit test scores will be reviewed for admission based on high school GPA.

First-time freshmen must submit the following: Application for admission and the nonrefundable application fee; Official high school transcript; Official ACT or SAT scores (optional for most applicants). Assured admission can be granted to students who have a 3.0 high school GPA regardless of ACT/SAT score. Students with a 2.7 to 2.99 GPA must also have a 20 ACT or 1020 SAT score for assured admission. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission.

An entering freshman must have a high school diploma and must meet one of the following criteria:
- 2.7 high school GPA or greater
- ACT composite score of 20 or greater (or concordant SAT score)
- GPA of 2.5-2.69 with an ACT composite of 16-19
Program name: Global Studies and Human Geography, Global Studies Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to MTSU is a separate process from applying to this major. Assured admission is granted to students with one of the following: 3.0 GPA or higher; OR 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or an SAT score of 1020. Students not meeting the assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. High school curriculum requirements: 4 units of English; 3 units of math (Algebra I, II, and Geometry or equivalents); 3 units of natural science; 1 unit of American history; 1 unit of European history, world history, or world geography; 1 unit of U.S. government or economics; 2 units of the same foreign language; 1 unit of visual or performing arts.
Program name: Global Studies and Human Geography, Human Geography Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to MTSU is a separate process from applying for a major. You may find admission information at the Undergraduate Admissions website.

To apply, prospective students must complete the undergraduate application for admission, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Submission of official ACT or SAT scores is optional for most applicants.
Program name: History, History 6-12 Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S./B.A.

Requirements: MTSU offers two paths for guaranteed freshman admission. Path 1: 2.7 GPA or higher. Path 2: A minimum 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT total score) AND a minimum 2.7 high school GPA. Required Documents: Official High School Transcript. Test Scores (optional for applicants with 2.7+ GPA).

For assured admission, first-time freshmen must meet one of the following criteria:
- 3.0 GPA
- 2.7 GPA and 22 ACT (1100 SAT)

Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. A decision will be based on GPA, test scores, and high school coursework.

To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following criteria:
22 ACT Composite or 1100 SAT (ERW+M)
or
3.5 high school GPA
or
3.0 high school GPA and 20 ACT or 1020 SAT (ERW+M)
or
2.7 high school GPA and a signed letter of recommendation from your principal or guidance counselor
Program name: Human Performance, Exercise Science Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Assured admission is granted to students with a standard high school diploma and a minimum 3.0 GPA, OR a standard high school diploma with a minimum 2.7 GPA AND an ACT composite of 22 or above (or 1100 SAT). Applicants must complete the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional for most applicants.
Program name: Human Sciences, Fashion Merchandising Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to the University allows students to declare a major in Interior Design. For students entering the program at the sophomore level or above, the Interior Design faculty will review the student's portfolio and transcripts to ensure proper placement in the Interior Design curriculum. To be considered for university admission as a first-time freshman, an applicant must have a 3.0 high school GPA OR a 2.7 high school GPA and an 18 ACT (or SAT equivalent).
Program name: Human Sciences, Interior Design Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: To be considered for undergraduate admission, applicants must complete and submit the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable $25 application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Standardized test scores like the ACT or SAT are not required for admission for students with a 3.0 or higher GPA, but are recommended for scholarship consideration.
Program name: Human Sciences, Nutrition and Food Science Concentration, B.S.

Requirements:
Admission to the B.S. in Industrial-Organizational Psychology requires the following:
- 24 credit hours completed
- Cumulative GPA of 2.5 or higher
- PSY 1410 (General Psychology) with a grade of C or better
- Submit an online application by the appropriate deadline: February 1 (for fall admission) or September 1 (for spring admission).

To be considered for regular admission, you must submit an application and meet one of the following criteria: 3.0 cumulative high school GPA OR 2.7 cumulative high school GPA AND 22 composite ACT or 1100 SAT OR Test Optional: 3.5 cumulative high school GPA.

MTSU is a test-optional university. Submission of ACT/SAT scores is optional and not required for admission. For guaranteed admission, students must present a minimum cumulative high school GPA of 3.0. Students with a 2.7 to 2.99 cumulative high school GPA will be reviewed for admission based on a combination of their GPA and ACT/SAT scores. Students who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements will be reviewed for admission based on a holistic review of their academic and supplemental information.
Program name: Integrated Studies, Applied Leadership Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to this program requires general admission to Middle Tennessee State University. According to the university's undergraduate admissions requirements, guaranteed admission for first-time freshmen requires a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. Applicants with a GPA between 2.7 and 2.99 may be admitted with a minimum ACT score of 19 or SAT score of 990. MTSU is a test-optional institution.

Program name: Integrated Studies, Public Safety Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Assured admission will be granted to students with a 3.0 high school GPA, regardless of ACT/SAT score. Students with a 2.7 to 2.99 high school GPA must have a 19 ACT or 990 SAT for assured admission. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed holistically. MTSU will not require an ACT or SAT score for admissions consideration for applicants with a 3.0+ high school GPA.
Students intending to major in Interior Design must meet the University’s general admission requirements.

To be considered for admission, you must meet one of the following criteria:
Guaranteed Admission
- High school GPA of 3.0 or higher
- OR a GPA of 2.7+ and an ACT of 22+ (or SAT equivalent)
Admission by Review
- High school GPA of 2.7 to 2.99 with no test scores
- OR a high school GPA below a 2.7 and a test score of 19-21 ACT (or SAT equivalent)
- OR a high school GPA of 2.5 or higher and no test score.
Applicants will be asked to submit a personal statement form.

Admission to the School of Journalism and Strategic Media is separate from admission to the university. To be admitted as a major in the School, a student must have completed 30 semester hours with a 2.50 grade point average and have passed the school’s Entrance Exam. Students may apply for admission as a pre-major after being admitted to the university. An overall GPA of 2.25 is required to graduate. For additional information about the Entrance Exam, students should contact the school.

For guaranteed admission to the university, freshmen must have a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite score of 22 or higher OR an SAT composite score of 1100 or higher. Applicants who do not meet these requirements can be considered for admission by review. Additionally, admission to the College of Media and Entertainment requires a 2.00 cumulative GPA. To be admitted to the Journalism major, students must earn a C or better in JOUR 2710.

MTSU is test-optional for admissions purposes for students with a 3.0 or higher high school GPA. Regular Admission requires a 3.0 high school GPA OR a 2.7 high school GPA and a 20 ACT (1020 SAT) composite. Conditional Admission is possible with a 2.7 GPA and an 18-19 ACT (940-1010 SAT) composite.
Program name: Journalism, Environmental Journalism and Communication Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Assured admission is granted to students who meet ONE of the following criteria: 3.0 GPA, OR; 2.7 GPA and an ACT composite of 20 or higher (or SAT equivalent), OR; 22 ACT composite or higher (or SAT equivalent). MTSU is a test-optional university through Fall 2025. Students may apply for admission with or without an ACT or SAT score.

Applicants must complete the undergraduate application, pay the nonrefundable application fee, and submit an official high school transcript. Submission of ACT or SAT scores is optional for applicants with a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher. For assured admission, applicants need a high school GPA of 3.0 or higher, OR an ACT composite score of 22 or higher, OR an SAT total score of 1100 or higher. Applications that do not meet assured admission requirements will undergo a holistic review.

To be considered for admission, you must submit an application for undergraduate admission and a non-refundable $25 application fee. You must also submit an official high school transcript. MTSU uses a holistic review for all freshman applicants. The primary criteria for admission are high school GPA and ACT/SAT score (optional for most). The academic rigor of high school courses and other information provided in your application may also be considered.

To apply for undergraduate admission to the university, applicants need a completed application, a nonrefundable $25 application fee, and an official high school transcript. MTSU has a test-optional policy, so ACT or SAT scores are not required for admission consideration.

For admission specifically into the Journalism major, students must first be admitted to the university. After matriculating, they must complete at least 15 semester hours with a minimum 2.25 GPA and successfully complete JOUR 2710 with a grade of C- or better.

All freshman applicants must submit the following: A completed application for undergraduate admission. A $25 nonrefundable application fee. An official high school transcript that shows a minimum of 16 college preparatory units. Official ACT or SAT scores may be submitted but are not required for admission.

Admission to the Jones College of Business is required. In addition to the University’s guaranteed admission requirements, the Jones College has its own admission requirements. Students must have a minimum 2.25 overall GPA (this includes transfer work), and must have completed all lower-division business courses: ACCT 2110 and 2120, ECON 2410 and 2420, BIA 2610, and either MATH 1630 or 1810. (Student must have a grade of C or better in all.) Students must also have completed their freshman English composition sequence (ENGL 1010 and 1020) and MATH 1630 or higher. (Grade of C or better.)

Admission to MTSU is based on a review of a student’s total high school performance as demonstrated by grades, test scores, and other supporting information. MTSU uses a 4.0 scale. Please see undergraduate admissions for more information. For assured admission, applicants must meet one of the following: 3.0 GPA; OR. 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or SAT of 1020; OR. a GPA of 2.5 with a 22 ACT or 1090 SAT. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed through our holistic review process. MTSU will consider other factors for admission, such as high school course work, academic letters of recommendation, and special circumstances as demonstrated in a personal statement.
Program name: Management, Human Resource Management Concentration, B.B.A.

Requirements: General requirements for admission include submitting an online application, paying a nonrefundable application fee, and providing official transcripts. For first-time freshmen, an official high school transcript is required. For graduate applicants, official transcripts from all previously attended colleges and universities are required. MTSU is a test-optional university for undergraduate admission; applicants may submit ACT/SAT scores, but they are not required for an admission decision.

Admission to MTSU is based upon a review of the high school record and test scores (ACT or SAT). The specific requirements are determined by the applicant’s high school grade point average (GPA). For more information about admission to MTSU, visit the Undergraduate Admissions website.

Students who graduate from high school will be automatically admitted to MTSU if they have a 3.0 GPA. Those who have a GPA of less than 3.0 will be reviewed for admission based on their GPA and ACT/SAT test scores. Final admission for all students requires: High school diploma with a final GPA, or GED with a minimum score of 450, or HiSET with a minimum score of 45.

Regular admission to the University requires a final high school GPA of 3.0 or higher OR a 2.7–2.99 GPA and a 19 ACT (990 SAT) OR a 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite regardless of GPA. MTSU will use a holistic review process for students who do not have an ACT or SAT score to provide. We will utilize a variety of factors to determine an admission decision, including but not limited to, high school courses, grades in those courses, and letters of recommendation.
Program name: Mathematical Sciences, Actuarial Science Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: To be considered for guaranteed admission, you need to meet the following criteria: GPA: 2.7 or higher AND ACT: 22 composite or higher (or SAT equivalent). If you have a GPA of 3.5 or higher, ACT/SAT scores are not required for an admission decision. If your GPA is below a 2.7, we will look at other factors like your ACT/SAT score, high school courses, and other items submitted with your application to make a holistic admission decision.

Initial admission to the university requires applicants to meet one of the following criteria: a 3.0 GPA or higher, OR a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or an SAT score of 1020. For formal admission into the Teacher Education Program, which is required to take upper-division education courses for this concentration, candidates must have a minimum 2.80 cumulative GPA, completion of specific foundational courses with a grade of 'C' or better, and either a composite score of 21 or higher on the ACT (or 1020 or higher on the SAT) OR passing scores on the Praxis CORE Academic Skills for Educators tests.
Program name: Mathematical Sciences, Mathematics Teacher Licensure Concentration, B.S.

Requirements:
Admission to MTSU is a separate process from admission to a major. Students should consult the Undergraduate Catalog for University admission requirements. Following admission to the University, students desiring a major in mathematical sciences must meet the specific requirements of the Department of Mathematical Sciences.

To be admitted to the mathematical sciences major, a student must have completed at least 30 semester hours with a cumulative GPA of at least 2.00 and have completed MATH 1910 with a grade of C (2.00) or better.

All students wishing to major or minor in music at MTSU must complete two applications: one for admission to the university and one to the School of Music. An audition for the School of Music faculty is also required. The School of Music application also serves as audition registration.

Students intending to major in music must first be admitted to the university, then must audition for the School of Music faculty. Admission to the university does not guarantee admission to the School of Music. The audition for the Commercial Songwriting concentration consists of two parts: a portfolio submission and a live audition/interview. The portfolio requires two original songs (audio recording and lyric sheet for each) and a short video introduction. The live audition includes a performance of one original song, a demonstration of music theory fundamentals, and an interview.

Admission to the Music Business program is separate from admission to the University. To be admitted to the music business concentration, a student must meet the general admission requirements of MTSU and successfully complete an audition on a principal instrument/voice for the School of Music faculty. Audition registration is online through the School of Music.

Admission to the School of Music is by audition for all music majors and minors. All prospective students who wish to be accepted as music majors or minors must successfully complete an audition on their principal instrument/voice. Prospective majors must apply to the University as music-intended majors prior to their School of Music audition. Students admitted to the B.M. in Music Industry must meet a secondary admission standard to be fully admitted to this competitive program. In order to become a candidate for the B.M. in Music Industry, a student must apply and be admitted to MTSU, declaring Music Industry as a major; and audition and be accepted for applied study at the 2000-level on a principal instrument or voice in the School of Music. Upon completion of the above, a student may seek candidacy status by completing an online candidacy application. To be considered for candidacy, a student must have a minimum 2.50 overall GPA and have completed RIM 1020 and MUS 1120 with a grade of C (2.0) or better. The candidacy application deadline is May 15.

In addition to university admission requirements, all students seeking a major in music must pass an audition. The audition determines a student's eligibility for admission to the School of Music and allows the student to be considered for a music scholarship. For specific information about audition dates and procedures, contact the School of Music (615) 898-2469 or visit the website.

All prospective music majors must successfully pass an audition for full acceptance into the MTSU School of Music. Acceptance to the university does not guarantee acceptance into the School of Music. Acceptance into the School of Music does not guarantee acceptance into the university. This is in addition to meeting the general university admission requirements.

All prospective students must first be admitted to the University before they can be officially admitted to the School of Music. All undergraduate students wishing to major in music must successfully complete an audition on their principal instrument and an interview with the faculty in their chosen area.

For the Music, Music Theory and Composition Concentration, B.M., applicants must:
1.  Submit a portfolio of at least three original compositions and/or arrangements. The scores should demonstrate a basic knowledge of music notation and an understanding of instrumental and/or vocal writing.
2.  Participate in a brief interview with the composition faculty.
3.  Perform one or two short, contrasting pieces on their major instrument or voice.

All entering undergraduate music majors are also required to take a theory placement exam prior to their first semester of enrollment.
Program name: Music, Music Theory and Composition Concentration, B.M.

Requirements:
Admission to the University does not guarantee admission to the School of Music. All prospective music majors must complete the following in addition to applying for university admission:
1. Complete the online School of Music application.
2. Pass an audition/interview.
3. Take the Music Theory Placement Exam.
Information about auditions and the Theory Placement Exam can be found on the School of Music website.

In addition to applying to the University, all prospective undergraduate music majors and minors MUST also complete the supplemental School of Music Application and audition for the music faculty. Acceptance into the School of Music is contingent upon acceptance into the University.

To be considered for admission into the B.S.N. program, students must meet the following criteria:
1. Be fully admitted to MTSU in good standing or be eligible for readmission.
2. Minimum cumulative GPA of 3.0 (4.0 scale). The cumulative GPA is calculated using all attempted college coursework from all institutions attended.
3. Minimum GPA of 3.0 in required science courses (BIOL 2010/2011, BIOL 2020/2021, BIOL 2230/2231, and CHEM 1030/1031 or higher). Science courses taken more than 5 years prior to application must be repeated.
4. Completion of all but 16 hours of University general education and nursing prerequisite course requirements.
5. Completion of the HESI A2 exam with a minimum cumulative score of 75%. The HESI A2 exam may only be taken one time per admission cycle.
6. A completed online School of Nursing application submitted through NursingCAS by the application deadline.

Guaranteed Admission: Option 1: 3.0 GPA or higher. Option 2: 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 or higher (or SAT of 1020 or higher). Holistic Review: For applicants who do not meet guaranteed admission requirements, MTSU also has a holistic review process. In addition to GPA and test scores, we will consider up to 14 other factors, including the rigor of high school courses, letters of recommendation, and an applicant’s demonstrated commitment to service and leadership.

To be guaranteed admission to MTSU, you must meet one of the following:
3.0 GPA
OR 2.7 GPA and 19 ACT (or 990 SAT)
OR 2.5 GPA and 21 ACT (or 1060 SAT)
OR Minimum 22 ACT (or 1100 SAT)
ACT or SAT scores are not required for admission for students with a 3.0+ high school GPA. A test score will be required for HOPE Scholarship eligibility.

To be eligible for guaranteed admission, you must meet one of the following:
3.5+ high school GPA
OR
3.0+ high school GPA AND 22+ ACT (1100+ SAT)
OR
Less than 3.0 high school GPA AND 25+ ACT (1200+ SAT)
(All GPAs are based on a 4.0 scale.)
Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission through a holistic review. MTSU will review each student holistically, considering the following: High school GPA, ACT/SAT score, Academic rigor, Essay, and Letters of Recommendation.

MTSU offers guaranteed admission for first-time freshmen who have completed the recommended high school curriculum and meet one of the following criteria: a 3.0 high school GPA with a 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT) or higher, OR a 3.5 high school GPA, regardless of ACT/SAT score. MTSU is a test-optional university, and applicants who do not meet the guaranteed admission requirements will be reviewed for a holistic admission decision.

MTSU will use either ACT or SAT scores along with high school GPA for admission decisions. Assured Admission requires a 3.0 GPA OR an ACT composite of 22 (or 1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. Students who apply with a 3.0 GPA or higher will not be required to submit a test score for an admission decision.

Program name: Physics, Quantum Science and Computing Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Assured admission for first-time freshmen is based on a combination of your high school GPA and ACT/SAT scores. You will be admitted if you have: A 3.0 GPA, regardless of ACT/SAT score (if provided) OR A minimum 2.7 GPA and a 22 ACT (1100 SAT) composite score.

MTSU offers guaranteed admission to students who meet one of the following academic criteria:

- 2.7 high school GPA or higher
- 22 ACT composite or higher
- 1100 SAT or higher

Students who have a 3.0 GPA or higher can apply for admission without submitting ACT or SAT scores.

For University Admission (First-Time Freshmen): Assured Admission requires a 3.0 GPA OR a 2.7 GPA and an ACT score of 20 (or SAT of 1020). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for holistic admission. For the Fall 2024 and Spring 2025 terms, first-time freshmen may be admitted to MTSU without a test score (ACT/SAT).

For Admission to the Major: Once a student has been admitted to the University, he/she may be admitted to the major upon reaching a total of 30 hours of college credit with a minimum GPA of 2.0.
Program name: Professional Studies, Health Administration Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to the Professional Studies major requires a minimum of 60 earned hours and a 2.0 GPA. For university admission requirements, please visit the Undergraduate Admissions website.
Program name: Professional Studies, Information Technology Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to the B.S. in Professional Studies requires an associate’s degree from a regionally accredited institution, 60 or more college credits from a regionally accredited institution, or military credits evaluated for college credit. A GPA of at least 2.0 is required.
Program name: Professional Studies, International Organizational Leadership Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to this program is not guaranteed. Admission will be determined at the time of advisement. Students must have a 2.0 GPA to be admitted.
Program name: Professional Studies, Organizational Leadership Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: To be considered for admission, you should have a minimum 3.0 GPA OR a minimum 22 ACT composite (1100 SAT). Applicants who do not meet these requirements can be reviewed for admission through a holistic review process. Holistic review factors include but are not limited to high school GPA, ACT/SAT scores, academic rigor, dual enrollment coursework, and non-cognitive factors.

Students who graduate from a state-approved high school will be automatically admitted to MTSU if they meet ONE of the following criteria:

3.0 GPA OR
22 ACT composite (1020 SAT) OR
2.7 GPA AND 19 ACT composite (900 SAT)

General university admission is required. Per the MTSU undergraduate admissions page, for assured admission, applicants need a 3.0+ GPA, or a 2.70-2.99 GPA with a 19 ACT composite (990 SAT total). MTSU is a test-optional institution. In addition, all Recording Industry majors must be admitted to candidacy before they can take upper-division (3000-4000 level) courses. To apply for candidacy, students must be admitted to MTSU, have a declared major in Recording Industry, have earned at least 45 semester hours, have a minimum 2.25 overall GPA, and have completed specific prerequisite courses with a grade of C or better.

All Recording Industry majors enter the university as pre-Recording Industry majors. Students must pass a candidacy review to be admitted into the program. To be eligible for the candidacy review, students must meet the following criteria: Have a minimum 2.0 overall GPA. Complete at least 30 credit hours. Pass the following courses with a grade of C or better: RIM 3000, RIM 3010, RIM 3600. Pass the Audio Production Candidacy Exam.
Program name: Recording Industry, Audio Production Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to the Recording Industry, Commercial Songwriting concentration is selective. Students must pass a juried audition for consideration for acceptance. The songwriting jury will require submission of a portfolio including two original songs and a statement of purpose. An interview is also required.
Program name: Recording Industry, Commercial Songwriting Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: Admission to the Recording Industry major is a two-step process. The first step is admission to the university. For freshman admission, applicants with a 3.0+ cumulative high school GPA are not required to submit an ACT/SAT score. Applicants with a high school GPA below 3.0 are required to submit a test score for review. An applicant with a 2.7 cumulative high school GPA requires a 20 ACT or a 1020 SAT composite score for admission consideration. The second step is admission to the major, which is competitive and determined by a candidacy review after enrollment. To be eligible for review, students must complete specific lower-division coursework with a grade of C or better and have an overall GPA of 2.5.
Program name: Recording Industry, Music Business Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: MTSU assures admission to students with a 3.0 GPA OR students with a 2.7 GPA AND an ACT score of 22 (or SAT equivalent). Students who do not meet assured admission requirements will be reviewed for admission through our holistic review process.
Admission to the University does not guarantee admission to this program. See a program advisor for details.
Program name: Science, Allied Health Science Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: All students must complete 16 core high school units to be considered for admission. In addition to the high school unit requirements, admission is based on high school grade point average (GPA) and test scores. MTSU provides assured admission to students who meet one of the following criteria: a 3.0 GPA or higher (test-optional); a 2.7 GPA or higher with a 22 ACT or 1100 SAT or higher; or a GPA between 2.7 and 2.99 with a 20 ACT or 1020 SAT or higher. Students who do not meet assured admission requirements may be considered through a holistic review process.
Program name: Science, Allied Health Technology Concentration, B.S.

Requirements: First-time freshmen who meet one of the following criteria are guaranteed admission to MTSU: 2.7 or higher cumulative high school GPA; An ACT composite score of 22 or higher OR a SAT total score of 1100 or higher (exam must be taken prior to March 2016 for SAT score); A redesigned SAT total score of 1130 or higher (exam taken March 2016 or after).

A minimum high school GPA of 3.5 on a 4.0 scale
A minimum ACT composite score of 25 (or SAT equivalent)
Demonstrate a commitment to a career in medicine.
Demonstrate a commitment to serving in a medically-underserved area.
Have a U.S. citizenship or be a U.S. permanent resident.
Meet the criteria as an underrepresented minority student.
Program name: Science, Medical School Early Acceptance Program (MSEAP), B.S.

Requirements: To be considered for admission, a student must have completed SW 2210, 60 credit hours, a 2.50 overall GPA, and have passed the departmental writing requirement. A formal application will be submitted for competitive review by the faculty. Students will be required to write a personal statement as part of their application. Admission is selective and based on G.P.A., the personal statement, and an interview with social work faculty.

To be eligible for admission to MTSU, you must meet the following academic requirements. You must meet the same high school unit requirements as a first-time freshman and have a 2.0 GPA on all prior college coursework.

Guaranteed Admission Requirements (must meet one):
- 3.0 GPA or higher
- 2.5 GPA or higher AND 22 ACT (1100 SAT)
- 2.7 GPA or higher AND 20 ACT (1020 SAT)

Test Optional Admission: Students who do not wish to provide an ACT or SAT score and have a 3.0 or higher cumulative high school GPA will be offered admission to MTSU.

To be considered for guaranteed admission, you need to meet one of the following academic criteria: 3.0 GPA or higher OR ACT composite score of 22 or higher OR SAT composite of 1100 or higher (combined Evidence-Based Reading and Writing + Math). In addition, you must complete the required 14 high school units.

MTSU will use a holistic review process that combines a student's GPA and test scores (if provided) to determine admission. Students with a 3.0 GPA or higher who choose not to submit a test score will be admitted. Students with a GPA between 2.7-2.99 who choose not to submit a test score will be reviewed through our holistic review process and could be asked to submit additional information, including an essay, to be considered for admission. Students with test scores (21 ACT/1060 SAT or higher) and a 2.7 GPA or higher will be admitted. Students with test scores (17-20 ACT/920-1050 SAT) and a 3.0 GPA or higher will be admitted.

To be eligible for assured admission to MTSU, you must meet one of the following:

High school GPA of 3.0 or higher

High school GPA of 2.5–2.69 AND 21 ACT or 1060 SAT

Applicants who do not meet the assured admission criteria will be reviewed for admission on a holistic basis. Holistic review is a process where we look at the whole student, not just their GPA and test scores. Factors that may be considered include: high school course work, extracurricular activities, letters of recommendation, and essays.

In addition to the university’s general requirements, applicants for regular admission into the Master of Science program in Computer Science must have a 3.00 GPA or a 2.75 GPA and a preferred combined score of 300 on the verbal and quantitative sections of the Graduate Record Examination (GRE). A student must have an undergraduate major in computer science or a related area with a significant number of upper-division computer science courses including Data Structures and Assembly Language or Computer Organization. Any deficiencies must be completed before unconditional admission will be granted. Admission is competitive; not all applicants who meet the minimum requirements are admitted.
